content: 1 Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, through the will of God, and Timotheus the brother, to the assembly of God that is in Corinth, with all the saints who are in all Achaia:
content_old: 1 Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, through the will of God, and Timotheus the brother, to the assembly of God that is in Corinth, with all the saints who are in all Achaia:

content: 2 Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ!
content_old: 2 Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ!

content: 3 Blessed is God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of the mercies, and God of all comfort,
content_old: 3 Blessed is God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of the mercies, and God of all comfort,

content: 4 who is comforting us in all our tribulation, for our being able to comfort those in any tribulation through the comfort with which we are comforted ourselves by God;
content_old: 4 who is comforting us in all our tribulation, for our being able to comfort those in any tribulation through the comfort with which we are comforted ourselves by God;

content: 5 because, as the sufferings of the Christ do abound to us, so through the Christ doth abound also our comfort;
content_old: 5 because, as the sufferings of the Christ do abound to us, so through the Christ doth abound also our comfort;

content: 6 and whether we be in tribulation, it is for your comfort and salvation, that is wrought in the enduring of the same sufferings that we also suffer; whether we are comforted, it is for your comfort and salvation.
content_old: 6 and whether we be in tribulation, it is for your comfort and salvation, that is wrought in the enduring of the same sufferings that we also suffer; whether we are comforted, it is for your comfort and salvation.

content: 7 And our hope is stedfast for you, knowing that even as ye are partakers of the sufferings—so also of the comfort.
content_old: 7 And our hope is stedfast for you, knowing that even as ye are partakers of the sufferings—so also of the comfort.

content: 8 For we do not wish you to be ignorant, brethren, of our tribulation that happened to us in Asia, that we were exceedingly burdened above our power, so that we despaired even of life;
content_old: 8 For we do not wish you to be ignorant, brethren, of our tribulation that happened to us in Asia, that we were exceedingly burdened above our power, so that we despaired even of life;

content: 9 but we ourselves in ourselves the sentence of the death have had, that we may not be trusting on ourselves, but on God, who is raising the dead,
content_old: 9 but we ourselves in ourselves the sentence of the death have had, that we may not be trusting on ourselves, but on God, who is raising the dead,

content: 10 who out of so great a death did deliver us, and doth deliver, in whom we have hoped that even yet He will deliver;
content_old: 10 who out of so great a death did deliver us, and doth deliver, in whom we have hoped that even yet He will deliver;

content: 11 ye working together also for us by your supplication, that the gift through many persons to us, through many may be thankfully acknowledged for us.
content_old: 11 ye working together also for us by your supplication, that the gift through many persons to us, through many may be thankfully acknowledged for us.

content: 12 For our glorying is this: the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and sincerity of God, not in fleshly wisdom, but in the grace of God, we did conduct ourselves in the world, and more abundantly toward you;
content_old: 12 For our glorying is this: the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and sincerity of God, not in fleshly wisdom, but in the grace of God, we did conduct ourselves in the world, and more abundantly toward you;

content: 13 for no other things do we write to you, but what ye either do read or also acknowledge, and I hope that also unto the end ye shall acknowledge,
content_old: 13 for no other things do we write to you, but what ye either do read or also acknowledge, and I hope that also unto the end ye shall acknowledge,

content: 14 according as also ye did acknowledge us in part, that your glory we are, even as also ye are ours, in the day of the Lord Jesus.
content_old: 14 according as also ye did acknowledge us in part, that your glory we are, even as also ye are ours, in the day of the Lord Jesus.

content: 15 And in this confidence I was purposing to come unto you before, that a second favour ye might have,
content_old: 15 And in this confidence I was purposing to come unto you before, that a second favour ye might have,

content: 16 and through you to pass to Macedonia, and again from Macedonia to come unto you, and by you to be sent forward to Judea.
content_old: 16 and through you to pass to Macedonia, and again from Macedonia to come unto you, and by you to be sent forward to Judea.

content: 17 This, therefore, counselling, did I then use the lightness; or the things that I counsel, according to the flesh do I counsel, that it may be with me Yes, yes, and No, no?
content_old: 17 This, therefore, counselling, did I then use the lightness; or the things that I counsel, according to the flesh do I counsel, that it may be with me Yes, yes, and No, no?

content: 18 and God is faithful, that our word unto you became not Yes and No,
content_old: 18 and God is faithful, that our word unto you became not Yes and No,

content: 19 for the Son of God, Jesus Christ, among you through us having been preached—through me and Silvanus and Timotheus—did not become Yes and No, but in him it hath become Yes;
content_old: 19 for the Son of God, Jesus Christ, among you through us having been preached—through me and Silvanus and Timotheus—did not become Yes and No, but in him it hath become Yes;

content: 20 for as many as are promises of God, in him are the Yes, and in him the Amen, for glory to God through us;
content_old: 20 for as many as are promises of God, in him are the Yes, and in him the Amen, for glory to God through us;

content: 21 and He who is confirming you with us into Christ, and did anoint us, is God,
content_old: 21 and He who is confirming you with us into Christ, and did anoint us, is God,

content: 22 who also sealed us, and gave the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts.
content_old: 22 who also sealed us, and gave the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts.

content: 23 And I for a witness on God do call upon my soul, that sparing you, I came not yet to Corinth;
content_old: 23 And I for a witness on God do call upon my soul, that sparing you, I came not yet to Corinth;

content: 1 And I decided this to myself, not again to come in sorrow unto you,
content_old: 1 And I decided this to myself, not again to come in sorrow unto you,

content: 2 for if I make you sorry, then who is he who is making me glad, except he who is made sorry by me?
content_old: 2 for if I make you sorry, then who is he who is making me glad, except he who is made sorry by me?

content: 3 and I wrote to you this same thing, that having come, I may not have sorrow from them of whom it behoved me to have joy, having confidence in you all, that my joy is of you all,
content_old: 3 and I wrote to you this same thing, that having come, I may not have sorrow from them of whom it behoved me to have joy, having confidence in you all, that my joy is of you all,

content: 4 for out of much tribulation and pressure of heart I wrote to you through many tears, not that ye might be made sorry, but that ye might know the love that I have more abundantly toward you.
content_old: 4 for out of much tribulation and pressure of heart I wrote to you through many tears, not that ye might be made sorry, but that ye might know the love that I have more abundantly toward you.

content: 5 And if any one hath caused sorrow, he hath not caused sorrow to me, but in part, that I may not burden you all;
content_old: 5 And if any one hath caused sorrow, he hath not caused sorrow to me, but in part, that I may not burden you all;

content: 6 sufficient to such a one is this punishment, that is by the more part,
content_old: 6 sufficient to such a one is this punishment, that is by the more part,

content: 7 so that, on the contrary, it is rather for you to forgive and to comfort, lest by over abundant sorrow such a one may be swallowed up;
content_old: 7 so that, on the contrary, it is rather for you to forgive and to comfort, lest by over abundant sorrow such a one may be swallowed up;

content: 8 wherefore, I call upon you to confirm love to him,
content_old: 8 wherefore, I call upon you to confirm love to him,

content: 9 for, for this also did I write, that I might know the proof of you, whether in regard to all things ye are obedient.
content_old: 9 for, for this also did I write, that I might know the proof of you, whether in regard to all things ye are obedient.

content: 10 And to whom ye forgive anything—I also; for I also, if I have forgiven anything, to whom I have forgiven it, because of you—in the person of Christ—I forgive it,
content_old: 10 And to whom ye forgive anything—I also; for I also, if I have forgiven anything, to whom I have forgiven it, because of you—in the person of Christ—I forgive it,

content: 11 that we may not be over-reached by the Adversary, for of his devices we are not ignorant.
content_old: 11 that we may not be over-reached by the Adversary, for of his devices we are not ignorant.

content: 12 And having come to Troas for the good news of the Christ, and a door to me having been opened in the Lord,
content_old: 12 And having come to Troas for the good news of the Christ, and a door to me having been opened in the Lord,

content: 13 I have not had rest to my spirit, on my not finding Titus my brother, but having taken leave of them, I went forth to Macedonia;
content_old: 13 I have not had rest to my spirit, on my not finding Titus my brother, but having taken leave of them, I went forth to Macedonia;

content: 14 and to God are thanks, who at all times is leading us in triumph in the Christ, and the fragrance of His knowledge He is manifesting through us in every place,
content_old: 14 and to God are thanks, who at all times is leading us in triumph in the Christ, and the fragrance of His knowledge He is manifesting through us in every place,

content: 15 because of Christ a sweet fragrance we are to God, in those being saved, and in those being lost;
content_old: 15 because of Christ a sweet fragrance we are to God, in those being saved, and in those being lost;

content: 16 to the one, indeed, a fragrance of death to death, and to the other, a fragrance of life to life; and for these things who is sufficient?
content_old: 16 to the one, indeed, a fragrance of death to death, and to the other, a fragrance of life to life; and for these things who is sufficient?

content: 1 Do we begin again to recommend ourselves, except we need, as some, letters of recommendation unto you, or from you?
content_old: 1 Do we begin again to recommend ourselves, except we need, as some, letters of recommendation unto you, or from you?

content: 2 our letter ye are, having been written in our hearts, known and read by all men,
content_old: 2 our letter ye are, having been written in our hearts, known and read by all men,

content: 3 manifested that ye are a letter of Christ ministered by us, written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God, not in the tablets of stone, but in fleshy tablets of the heart,
content_old: 3 manifested that ye are a letter of Christ ministered by us, written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God, not in the tablets of stone, but in fleshy tablets of the heart,

content: 4 and such trust we have through the Christ toward God,
content_old: 4 and such trust we have through the Christ toward God,

content: 5 not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think anything, as of ourselves, but our sufficiency is of God.
content_old: 5 not that we are sufficient of ourselves to think anything, as of ourselves, but our sufficiency is of God.

content: 6 Who also made us sufficient to be ministrants of a new covenant, not of letter, but of spirit; for the letter doth kill, and the spirit doth make alive.
content_old: 6 Who also made us sufficient to be ministrants of a new covenant, not of letter, but of spirit; for the letter doth kill, and the spirit doth make alive.

content: 7 and if the ministration of the death, in letters, engraved in stones, came in glory, so that the sons of Israel were not able to look stedfastly to the face of Moses, because of the glory of his face���which was being made useless,
content_old: 7 and if the ministration of the death, in letters, engraved in stones, came in glory, so that the sons of Israel were not able to look stedfastly to the face of Moses, because of the glory of his face���which was being made useless,

content: 8 how shall the ministration of the Spirit not be more in glory?
content_old: 8 how shall the ministration of the Spirit not be more in glory?

content: 9 for if the ministration of the condemnation is glory, much more doth the ministration of the righteousness abound in glory;
content_old: 9 for if the ministration of the condemnation is glory, much more doth the ministration of the righteousness abound in glory;

content: 10 for also even that which hath been glorious, hath not been glorious—in this respect, because of the superior glory;
content_old: 10 for also even that which hath been glorious, hath not been glorious—in this respect, because of the superior glory;

content: 11 for if that which is being made useless is through glory, much more that which is remaining is in glory.
content_old: 11 for if that which is being made useless is through glory, much more that which is remaining is in glory.

content: 12 Having, then, such hope, we use much freedom of speech,
content_old: 12 Having, then, such hope, we use much freedom of speech,

content: 13 and are not as Moses, who was putting a vail upon his own face, for the sons of Israel not stedfastly to look to the end of that which is being made useless,
content_old: 13 and are not as Moses, who was putting a vail upon his own face, for the sons of Israel not stedfastly to look to the end of that which is being made useless,

content: 14 but their minds were hardened, for unto this day the same vail at the reading of the Old Covenant doth remain unwithdrawn—which in Christ is being made useless—
content_old: 14 but their minds were hardened, for unto this day the same vail at the reading of the Old Covenant doth remain unwithdrawn—which in Christ is being made useless—

content: 15 but till to-day, when Moses is read, a vail upon their heart doth lie,
content_old: 15 but till to-day, when Moses is read, a vail upon their heart doth lie,

content: 16 and whenever they may turn unto the Lord, the vail is taken away.
content_old: 16 and whenever they may turn unto the Lord, the vail is taken away.

content: 17 And the Lord is the Spirit; and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty;
content_old: 17 And the Lord is the Spirit; and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty;

content: 1 Because of this, having this ministration, according as we did receive kindness, we do not faint,
content_old: 1 Because of this, having this ministration, according as we did receive kindness, we do not faint,

content: 2 but did renounce for ourselves the hidden things of shame, not walking in craftiness, nor deceitfully using the word of God, but by the manifestation of the truth recommending ourselves unto every conscience of men, before God;
content_old: 2 but did renounce for ourselves the hidden things of shame, not walking in craftiness, nor deceitfully using the word of God, but by the manifestation of the truth recommending ourselves unto every conscience of men, before God;

content: 3 and if also our good news is vailed, in those perishing it is vailed,
content_old: 3 and if also our good news is vailed, in those perishing it is vailed,

content: 4 in whom the god of this age did blind the minds of the unbelieving, that there doth not shine forth to them the enlightening of the good news of the glory of the Christ, who is the image of God;
content_old: 4 in whom the god of this age did blind the minds of the unbelieving, that there doth not shine forth to them the enlightening of the good news of the glory of the Christ, who is the image of God;

content: 5 for not ourselves do we preach, but Christ Jesus—Lord, and ourselves your servants because of Jesus;
content_old: 5 for not ourselves do we preach, but Christ Jesus—Lord, and ourselves your servants because of Jesus;

content: 6 because it is God who said, Out of darkness light is to shine, who did shine in our hearts, for the enlightening of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.
content_old: 6 because it is God who said, Out of darkness light is to shine, who did shine in our hearts, for the enlightening of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

content: 7 And we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellency of the power may be of God, and not of us.
content_old: 7 And we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the excellency of the power may be of God, and not of us.

content: 8 On every side being in tribulation, but not straitened; perplexed, but not in despair;
content_old: 8 On every side being in tribulation, but not straitened; perplexed, but not in despair;

content: 9 persecuted, but not forsaken; cast down, but not destroyed;
content_old: 9 persecuted, but not forsaken; cast down, but not destroyed;

content: 10 at all times the dying of the Lord Jesus bearing about in the body, that the life also of Jesus in our body may be manifested,
content_old: 10 at all times the dying of the Lord Jesus bearing about in the body, that the life also of Jesus in our body may be manifested,

content: 11 for always are we who are living delivered up to death because of Jesus, that the life also of Jesus may be manifested in our dying flesh,
content_old: 11 for always are we who are living delivered up to death because of Jesus, that the life also of Jesus may be manifested in our dying flesh,

content: 12 so that, the death indeed in us doth work, and the life in you.
content_old: 12 so that, the death indeed in us doth work, and the life in you.

content: 13 And having the same spirit of the faith, according to that which hath been written, ‘I believed, therefore I did speak;’ we also do believe, therefore also do we speak;
content_old: 13 And having the same spirit of the faith, according to that which hath been written, ‘I believed, therefore I did speak;’ we also do believe, therefore also do we speak;

content: 14 knowing that He who did raise up the Lord Jesus, us also through Jesus shall raise up, and shall present with you,
content_old: 14 knowing that He who did raise up the Lord Jesus, us also through Jesus shall raise up, and shall present with you,

content: 15 for the all things are because of you, that the grace having been multiplied, because of the thanksgiving of the more, may abound to the glory of God;
content_old: 15 for the all things are because of you, that the grace having been multiplied, because of the thanksgiving of the more, may abound to the glory of God;

content: 16 wherefore, we faint not, but if also our outward man doth decay, yet the inward is renewed day by day;
content_old: 16 wherefore, we faint not, but if also our outward man doth decay, yet the inward is renewed day by day;

content: 17 for the momentary light matter of our tribulation, more and more exceedingly an age-during weight of glory doth work out for us—
content_old: 17 for the momentary light matter of our tribulation, more and more exceedingly an age-during weight of glory doth work out for us—

content: 1 For we have known that if our earthly house of the tabernacle may be thrown down, a building from God we have, an house not made with hands—age-during—in the heavens,
content_old: 1 For we have known that if our earthly house of the tabernacle may be thrown down, a building from God we have, an house not made with hands—age-during—in the heavens,

content: 2 for also in this we groan, with our dwelling that is from heaven earnestly desiring to clothe ourselves,
content_old: 2 for also in this we groan, with our dwelling that is from heaven earnestly desiring to clothe ourselves,

content: 3 if so be that, having clothed ourselves, we shall not be found naked,
content_old: 3 if so be that, having clothed ourselves, we shall not be found naked,

content: 4 for we also who are in the tabernacle do groan, being burdened, seeing we wish not to unclothe ourselves, but to clothe ourselves, that the mortal may be swallowed up of the life.
content_old: 4 for we also who are in the tabernacle do groan, being burdened, seeing we wish not to unclothe ourselves, but to clothe ourselves, that the mortal may be swallowed up of the life.

content: 5 And He who did work us to this self-same thing is God, who also did give to us the earnest of the Spirit;
content_old: 5 And He who did work us to this self-same thing is God, who also did give to us the earnest of the Spirit;

content: 6 having courage, then, at all times, and knowing that being at home in the body, we are away from home from the Lord,—
content_old: 6 having courage, then, at all times, and knowing that being at home in the body, we are away from home from the Lord,—

content: 7 for through faith we walk, not through sight—
content_old: 7 for through faith we walk, not through sight—

content: 8 we have courage, and are well pleased rather to be away from the home of the body, and to be at home with the Lord.
content_old: 8 we have courage, and are well pleased rather to be away from the home of the body, and to be at home with the Lord.

content: 9 Wherefore also we are ambitious, whether at home or away from home, to be well pleasing to him,
content_old: 9 Wherefore also we are ambitious, whether at home or away from home, to be well pleasing to him,

content: 10 for all of us it behoveth to be manifested before the tribunal of the Christ, that each one may receive the things done through the body, in reference to the things that he did, whether good or evil;
content_old: 10 for all of us it behoveth to be manifested before the tribunal of the Christ, that each one may receive the things done through the body, in reference to the things that he did, whether good or evil;

content: 11 having known, therefore, the fear of the Lord, we persuade men, and to God we are manifested, and I hope also in your consciences to have been manifested.
content_old: 11 having known, therefore, the fear of the Lord, we persuade men, and to God we are manifested, and I hope also in your consciences to have been manifested.

content: 12 For not again ourselves do we recommend to you, but we are giving occasion to you of glorifying in our behalf, that ye may have something in reference to those glorifying in face and not in heart;
content_old: 12 For not again ourselves do we recommend to you, but we are giving occasion to you of glorifying in our behalf, that ye may have something in reference to those glorifying in face and not in heart;

content: 13 for whether we were beside ourselves, it was to God; whether we be of sound mind—it is to you,
content_old: 13 for whether we were beside ourselves, it was to God; whether we be of sound mind—it is to you,

content: 14 for the love of the Christ doth constrain us, having judged thus: that if one for all died, then the whole died,
content_old: 14 for the love of the Christ doth constrain us, having judged thus: that if one for all died, then the whole died,

content: 15 and for all he died, that those living, no more to themselves may live, but to him who died for them, and was raised again.
content_old: 15 and for all he died, that those living, no more to themselves may live, but to him who died for them, and was raised again.

content: 16 So that we henceforth have known no one according to the flesh, and even if we have known Christ according to the flesh, yet now we know him no more;
content_old: 16 So that we henceforth have known no one according to the flesh, and even if we have known Christ according to the flesh, yet now we know him no more;

content: 17 so that if any one is in Christ—he is a new creature; the old things did pass away, lo, become new have the all things.
content_old: 17 so that if any one is in Christ—he is a new creature; the old things did pass away, lo, become new have the all things.

content: 18 And the all things are of God, who reconciled us to Himself through Jesus Christ, and did give to us the ministration of the reconciliation,
content_old: 18 And the all things are of God, who reconciled us to Himself through Jesus Christ, and did give to us the ministration of the reconciliation,

content: 19 how that God was in Christ—a world reconciling to Himself, not reckoning to them their trespasses; and having put in us the word of the reconciliation,
content_old: 19 how that God was in Christ—a world reconciling to Himself, not reckoning to them their trespasses; and having put in us the word of the reconciliation,

content: 20 in behalf of Christ, then, we are ambassadors, as if God were calling through us, we beseech, in behalf of Christ, ‘Be ye reconciled to God;’
content_old: 20 in behalf of Christ, then, we are ambassadors, as if God were calling through us, we beseech, in behalf of Christ, ‘Be ye reconciled to God;’

content: 1 And working together also we call upon you that ye receive not in vain the grace of God—
content_old: 1 And working together also we call upon you that ye receive not in vain the grace of God—

content: 2 for He saith, ‘In an acceptable time I did hear thee, and in a day of salvation I did help thee, lo, now is a well-accepted time; lo, now, a day of salvation,’—
content_old: 2 for He saith, ‘In an acceptable time I did hear thee, and in a day of salvation I did help thee, lo, now is a well-accepted time; lo, now, a day of salvation,’—

content: 3 in nothing giving any cause of offence, that the ministration may be not blamed,
content_old: 3 in nothing giving any cause of offence, that the ministration may be not blamed,

content: 4 but in everything recommending ourselves as God’s ministrants; in much patience, in tribulations, in necessities, in distresses,
content_old: 4 but in everything recommending ourselves as God’s ministrants; in much patience, in tribulations, in necessities, in distresses,

content: 5 in stripes, in imprisonments, in insurrections, in labours, in watchings, in fastings,
content_old: 5 in stripes, in imprisonments, in insurrections, in labours, in watchings, in fastings,

content: 6 in pureness, in knowledge, in long-suffering, in kindness, in the Holy Spirit, in love unfeigned,
content_old: 6 in pureness, in knowledge, in long-suffering, in kindness, in the Holy Spirit, in love unfeigned,

content: 7 in the word of truth, in the power of God, through the armour of the righteousness, on the right and on the left,
content_old: 7 in the word of truth, in the power of God, through the armour of the righteousness, on the right and on the left,

content: 8 through glory and dishonour, through evil report and good report, as leading astray, and true;
content_old: 8 through glory and dishonour, through evil report and good report, as leading astray, and true;

content: 9 as unknown, and recognized; as dying, and lo, we live; as chastened, and not put to death;
content_old: 9 as unknown, and recognized; as dying, and lo, we live; as chastened, and not put to death;

content: 10 as sorrowful, and always rejoicing; as poor, and making many rich; as having nothing, and possessing all things.
content_old: 10 as sorrowful, and always rejoicing; as poor, and making many rich; as having nothing, and possessing all things.

content: 11 Our mouth hath been open unto you, O Corinthians, our heart hath been enlarged!
content_old: 11 Our mouth hath been open unto you, O Corinthians, our heart hath been enlarged!

content: 12 ye are not straitened in us, and ye are straitened in your own bowels,
content_old: 12 ye are not straitened in us, and ye are straitened in your own bowels,

content: 13 and as a recompense of the same kind, (as to children I say it,) be ye enlarged—also ye!
content_old: 13 and as a recompense of the same kind, (as to children I say it,) be ye enlarged—also ye!

content: 14 Become not yoked with others—unbelievers, for what partaking is there to righteousness and lawlessness?
content_old: 14 Become not yoked with others—unbelievers, for what partaking is there to righteousness and lawlessness?

content: 15 and what fellowship to light with darkness? and what concord to Christ with Belial? or what part to a believer with an unbeliever?
content_old: 15 and what fellowship to light with darkness? and what concord to Christ with Belial? or what part to a believer with an unbeliever?

content: 16 and what agreement to the sanctuary of God with idols? for ye are a sanctuary of the living God, according as God said—‘I will dwell in them, and will walk among them, and I will be their God, and they shall be My people,
content_old: 16 and what agreement to the sanctuary of God with idols? for ye are a sanctuary of the living God, according as God said—‘I will dwell in them, and will walk among them, and I will be their God, and they shall be My people,

content: 17 wherefore, come ye forth out of the midst of them, and be separated, saith the Lord, and an unclean thing do not touch, and I—I will receive you,
content_old: 17 wherefore, come ye forth out of the midst of them, and be separated, saith the Lord, and an unclean thing do not touch, and I—I will receive you,

content: 1 Having, then, these promises, beloved, may we cleanse ourselves from every pollution of flesh and spirit, perfecting sanctification in the fear of God;
content_old: 1 Having, then, these promises, beloved, may we cleanse ourselves from every pollution of flesh and spirit, perfecting sanctification in the fear of God;

content: 2 receive us; no one did we wrong; no one did we waste; no one did we defraud;
content_old: 2 receive us; no one did we wrong; no one did we waste; no one did we defraud;

content: 3 not to condemn you do I say it, for I have said before that in our hearts ye are to die with and to live with;
content_old: 3 not to condemn you do I say it, for I have said before that in our hearts ye are to die with and to live with;

content: 4 great is my freedom of speech unto you, great my glory on your behalf; I have been filled with the comfort, I overabound with the joy on all our tribulation.
content_old: 4 great is my freedom of speech unto you, great my glory on your behalf; I have been filled with the comfort, I overabound with the joy on all our tribulation.

content: 5 For also we, having come to Macedonia, no relaxation hath our flesh had, but on every side we are in tribulation, without are fightings, within—fears;
content_old: 5 For also we, having come to Macedonia, no relaxation hath our flesh had, but on every side we are in tribulation, without are fightings, within—fears;

content: 6 but He who is comforting the cast-down—God—He did comfort us in the presence of Titus;
content_old: 6 but He who is comforting the cast-down—God—He did comfort us in the presence of Titus;

content: 7 and not only in his presence, but also in the comfort with which he was comforted over you, declaring to us your longing desire, your lamentation, your zeal for me, so that the more I did rejoice,
content_old: 7 and not only in his presence, but also in the comfort with which he was comforted over you, declaring to us your longing desire, your lamentation, your zeal for me, so that the more I did rejoice,

content: 8 because even if I made you sorry in the letter, I do not repent—if even I did repent—for I perceive that the letter, even if for an hour, did make you sorry.
content_old: 8 because even if I made you sorry in the letter, I do not repent—if even I did repent—for I perceive that the letter, even if for an hour, did make you sorry.

content: 9 I now do rejoice, not that ye were made sorry, but that ye were made sorry to reformation, for ye were made sorry toward God, that in nothing ye might receive damage from us;
content_old: 9 I now do rejoice, not that ye were made sorry, but that ye were made sorry to reformation, for ye were made sorry toward God, that in nothing ye might receive damage from us;

content: 10 for the sorrow toward God reformation to salvation not to be repented of doth work, and the sorrow of the world doth work death,
content_old: 10 for the sorrow toward God reformation to salvation not to be repented of doth work, and the sorrow of the world doth work death,

content: 11 for, lo, this same thing—your being made sorry toward God—how much diligence it doth work in you! but defence, but displeasure, but fear, but longing desire, but zeal, but revenge; in every thing ye did approve yourselves to be pure in the matter.
content_old: 11 for, lo, this same thing—your being made sorry toward God—how much diligence it doth work in you! but defence, but displeasure, but fear, but longing desire, but zeal, but revenge; in every thing ye did approve yourselves to be pure in the matter.

content: 12 If, then, I also wrote to you—not for his cause who did wrong, nor for his cause who did suffer wrong, but for our diligence in your behalf being manifested unto you before God—
content_old: 12 If, then, I also wrote to you—not for his cause who did wrong, nor for his cause who did suffer wrong, but for our diligence in your behalf being manifested unto you before God—

content: 13 because of this we have been comforted in your comfort, and more abundantly the more did we rejoice in the joy of Titus, that his spirit hath been refreshed from you all;
content_old: 13 because of this we have been comforted in your comfort, and more abundantly the more did we rejoice in the joy of Titus, that his spirit hath been refreshed from you all;

content: 14 because if anything to him in your behalf I have boasted, I was not put to shame; but as all things in truth we did speak to you, so also our boasting before Titus became truth,
content_old: 14 because if anything to him in your behalf I have boasted, I was not put to shame; but as all things in truth we did speak to you, so also our boasting before Titus became truth,

content: 15 and his tender affection is more abundantly toward you, remembering the obedience of you all, how with fear and trembling ye did receive him;
content_old: 15 and his tender affection is more abundantly toward you, remembering the obedience of you all, how with fear and trembling ye did receive him;

content: 1 And we make known to you, brethren, the grace of God, that hath been given in the assemblies of Macedonia,
content_old: 1 And we make known to you, brethren, the grace of God, that hath been given in the assemblies of Macedonia,

content: 2 because in much trial of tribulation the abundance of their joy, and their deep poverty, did abound to the riches of their liberality;
content_old: 2 because in much trial of tribulation the abundance of their joy, and their deep poverty, did abound to the riches of their liberality;

content: 3 because, according to their power, I testify, and above their power, they were willing of themselves,
content_old: 3 because, according to their power, I testify, and above their power, they were willing of themselves,

content: 4 with much entreaty calling on us to receive the favour and the fellowship of the ministration to the saints,
content_old: 4 with much entreaty calling on us to receive the favour and the fellowship of the ministration to the saints,

content: 5 and not according as we expected, but themselves they did give first to the Lord, and to us, through the will of God,
content_old: 5 and not according as we expected, but themselves they did give first to the Lord, and to us, through the will of God,

content: 6 so that we exhorted Titus, that, according as he did begin before, so also he may finish to you also this favour.
content_old: 6 so that we exhorted Titus, that, according as he did begin before, so also he may finish to you also this favour.

content: 7 But even as in every thing ye do abound, in faith, and word, and knowledge, and all diligence, and in your love to us, that also in this grace ye may abound;
content_old: 7 But even as in every thing ye do abound, in faith, and word, and knowledge, and all diligence, and in your love to us, that also in this grace ye may abound;

content: 8 not according to command do I speak, but because of the diligence of others, and of your love proving the genuineness,
content_old: 8 not according to command do I speak, but because of the diligence of others, and of your love proving the genuineness,

content: 9 for ye know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that because of you he became poor—being rich, that ye by that poverty may become rich.
content_old: 9 for ye know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that because of you he became poor—being rich, that ye by that poverty may become rich.

content: 10 and an opinion in this do I give: for this to you is expedient, who not only to do, but also to will, did begin before—a year ago,
content_old: 10 and an opinion in this do I give: for this to you is expedient, who not only to do, but also to will, did begin before—a year ago,

content: 11 and now also finish doing it, that even as there is the readiness of the will, so also the finishing, out of that which ye have,
content_old: 11 and now also finish doing it, that even as there is the readiness of the will, so also the finishing, out of that which ye have,

content: 12 for if the willing mind is present, according to that which any one may have it is well-accepted, not according to that which he hath not;
content_old: 12 for if the willing mind is present, according to that which any one may have it is well-accepted, not according to that which he hath not;

content: 13 for not that for others release, and ye pressured, do I speak,
content_old: 13 for not that for others release, and ye pressured, do I speak,

content: 14 but by equality, at the present time your abundance—for their want, that also their abundance may be for your want, that there may be equality,
content_old: 14 but by equality, at the present time your abundance—for their want, that also their abundance may be for your want, that there may be equality,

content: 15 according as it hath been written, ‘He who did gather much, had nothing over; and he who did gather little, had no lack.’
content_old: 15 according as it hath been written, ‘He who did gather much, had nothing over; and he who did gather little, had no lack.’

content: 16 And thanks to God, who is putting the same diligence for you in the heart of Titus,
content_old: 16 And thanks to God, who is putting the same diligence for you in the heart of Titus,

content: 17 because indeed the exhortation he accepted, and being more diligent, of his own accord he went forth unto you,
content_old: 17 because indeed the exhortation he accepted, and being more diligent, of his own accord he went forth unto you,

content: 18 and we sent with him the brother, whose praise in the good news is through all the assemblies,
content_old: 18 and we sent with him the brother, whose praise in the good news is through all the assemblies,

content: 19 and not only so, but who was also appointed by vote by the assemblies, our fellow-traveller, with this favour that is ministered by us, unto the glory of the same Lord, and your willing mind;
content_old: 19 and not only so, but who was also appointed by vote by the assemblies, our fellow-traveller, with this favour that is ministered by us, unto the glory of the same Lord, and your willing mind;

content: 20 avoiding this, lest any one may blame us in this abundance that is ministered by us,
content_old: 20 avoiding this, lest any one may blame us in this abundance that is ministered by us,

content: 21 providing right things, not only before the Lord, but also before men;
content_old: 21 providing right things, not only before the Lord, but also before men;

content: 22 and we sent with them our brother, whom we proved in many things many times being diligent, and now much more diligent, by the great confidence that is toward you,
content_old: 22 and we sent with them our brother, whom we proved in many things many times being diligent, and now much more diligent, by the great confidence that is toward you,

content: 23 whether—about Titus—my partner and towards you fellow-worker, whether—our brethren, apostles of assemblies—glory of Christ;
content_old: 23 whether—about Titus—my partner and towards you fellow-worker, whether—our brethren, apostles of assemblies—glory of Christ;

content: 1 For, indeed, concerning the ministration that is for the saints, it is superfluous for me to write to you,
content_old: 1 For, indeed, concerning the ministration that is for the saints, it is superfluous for me to write to you,

content: 2 for I have known your readiness of mind, which in your behalf I boast of to Macedonians, that Achaia hath been prepared a year ago, and the zeal of you did stir up the more part,
content_old: 2 for I have known your readiness of mind, which in your behalf I boast of to Macedonians, that Achaia hath been prepared a year ago, and the zeal of you did stir up the more part,

content: 3 and I sent the brethren, that our boasting on your behalf may not be made vain in this respect; that, according as I said, ye may be ready,
content_old: 3 and I sent the brethren, that our boasting on your behalf may not be made vain in this respect; that, according as I said, ye may be ready,

content: 4 lest if Macedonians may come with me, and find you unprepared, we—we may be put to shame (that we say not—ye) in this same confidence of boasting.
content_old: 4 lest if Macedonians may come with me, and find you unprepared, we—we may be put to shame (that we say not—ye) in this same confidence of boasting.

content: 5 Necessary, therefore, I thought it to exhort the brethren, that they may go before to you, and may make up before your formerly announced blessing, that this be ready, as a blessing, and not as covetousness.
content_old: 5 Necessary, therefore, I thought it to exhort the brethren, that they may go before to you, and may make up before your formerly announced blessing, that this be ready, as a blessing, and not as covetousness.

content: 6 And this: He who is sowing sparingly, sparingly also shall reap; and he who is sowing in blessings, in blessings also shall reap;
content_old: 6 And this: He who is sowing sparingly, sparingly also shall reap; and he who is sowing in blessings, in blessings also shall reap;

content: 7 each one, according as he doth purpose in heart, not out of sorrow or out of necessity, for a cheerful giver doth God love,
content_old: 7 each one, according as he doth purpose in heart, not out of sorrow or out of necessity, for a cheerful giver doth God love,

content: 8 and God is able all grace to cause to abound to you, that in every thing always all sufficiency having, ye may abound to every good work,
content_old: 8 and God is able all grace to cause to abound to you, that in every thing always all sufficiency having, ye may abound to every good work,

content: 9 (according as it hath been written, ‘He dispersed abroad, he gave to the poor, his righteousness doth remain to the age,’)
content_old: 9 (according as it hath been written, ‘He dispersed abroad, he gave to the poor, his righteousness doth remain to the age,’)

content: 10 and may He who is supplying seed to the sower, and bread for food, supply and multiply your seed sown, and increase the fruits of your righteousness,
content_old: 10 and may He who is supplying seed to the sower, and bread for food, supply and multiply your seed sown, and increase the fruits of your righteousness,

content: 11 in every thing being enriched to all liberality, which doth work through us thanksgiving to God,
content_old: 11 in every thing being enriched to all liberality, which doth work through us thanksgiving to God,

content: 12 because the ministration of this service not only is supplying the wants of the saints, but is also abounding through many thanksgivings to God,
content_old: 12 because the ministration of this service not only is supplying the wants of the saints, but is also abounding through many thanksgivings to God,

content: 13 through the proof of this ministration glorifying God for the subjection of your confession to the good news of the Christ, and for the liberality of the fellowship to them and to all,
content_old: 13 through the proof of this ministration glorifying God for the subjection of your confession to the good news of the Christ, and for the liberality of the fellowship to them and to all,

content: 14 and by their supplication in your behalf, longing after you because of the exceeding grace of God upon you;
content_old: 14 and by their supplication in your behalf, longing after you because of the exceeding grace of God upon you;

content: 1 And I, Paul, myself, do call upon you—through the meekness and gentleness of the Christ—who in presence, indeed am humble among you, and being absent, have courage toward you,
content_old: 1 And I, Paul, myself, do call upon you—through the meekness and gentleness of the Christ—who in presence, indeed am humble among you, and being absent, have courage toward you,

content: 2 and I beseech you, that, being present, I may not have courage, with the confidence with which I reckon to be bold against certain reckoning us as walking according to the flesh;
content_old: 2 and I beseech you, that, being present, I may not have courage, with the confidence with which I reckon to be bold against certain reckoning us as walking according to the flesh;

content: 3 for walking in the flesh, not according to the flesh do we war,
content_old: 3 for walking in the flesh, not according to the flesh do we war,

content: 4 for the weapons of our warfare are not fleshly, but powerful to God for bringing down of strongholds,
content_old: 4 for the weapons of our warfare are not fleshly, but powerful to God for bringing down of strongholds,

content: 5 reasonings bringing down, and every high thing lifted up against the knowledge of God, and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of the Christ,
content_old: 5 reasonings bringing down, and every high thing lifted up against the knowledge of God, and bringing into captivity every thought to the obedience of the Christ,

content: 6 and being in readiness to avenge every disobedience, whenever your obedience may be fulfilled.
content_old: 6 and being in readiness to avenge every disobedience, whenever your obedience may be fulfilled.

content: 7 The things in presence do ye see? if any one hath trusted in himself to be Christ’s, this let him reckon again from himself, that according as he is Christ’s, so also we are Christ’s;
content_old: 7 The things in presence do ye see? if any one hath trusted in himself to be Christ’s, this let him reckon again from himself, that according as he is Christ’s, so also we are Christ’s;

content: 8 for even if also anything more abundantly I shall boast concerning our authority, that the Lord gave us for building up, and not for casting you down, I shall not be ashamed;
content_old: 8 for even if also anything more abundantly I shall boast concerning our authority, that the Lord gave us for building up, and not for casting you down, I shall not be ashamed;

content: 9 that I may not seem as if I would terrify you through the letters,
content_old: 9 that I may not seem as if I would terrify you through the letters,

content: 10 ‘because the letters indeed—saith one—are weighty and strong, and the bodily presence weak, and the speech despicable.’
content_old: 10 ‘because the letters indeed—saith one—are weighty and strong, and the bodily presence weak, and the speech despicable.’

content: 11 This one—let him reckon thus: that such as we are in word, through letters, being absent, such also, being present, we are in deed.
content_old: 11 This one—let him reckon thus: that such as we are in word, through letters, being absent, such also, being present, we are in deed.

content: 12 For we do not make bold to rank or to compare ourselves with certain of those commending themselves, but they, among themselves measuring themselves, and comparing themselves with themselves, are not wise,
content_old: 12 For we do not make bold to rank or to compare ourselves with certain of those commending themselves, but they, among themselves measuring themselves, and comparing themselves with themselves, are not wise,

content: 13 and we in regard to the unmeasured things will not boast ourselves, but after the measure of the line that the God of measure did appoint to us—to reach even unto you;
content_old: 13 and we in regard to the unmeasured things will not boast ourselves, but after the measure of the line that the God of measure did appoint to us—to reach even unto you;

content: 14 for not as not reaching to you do we stretch ourselves overmuch, for even unto you did we come in the good news of the Christ,
content_old: 14 for not as not reaching to you do we stretch ourselves overmuch, for even unto you did we come in the good news of the Christ,

content: 15 not boasting of the things not measured, in other men’s labours, and having hope—your faith increasing—in you to be enlarged, according to our line—into abundance,
content_old: 15 not boasting of the things not measured, in other men’s labours, and having hope—your faith increasing—in you to be enlarged, according to our line—into abundance,

content: 16 in the places beyond you to proclaim good news, not in another’s line in regard to the things made ready, to boast;
content_old: 16 in the places beyond you to proclaim good news, not in another’s line in regard to the things made ready, to boast;

content: 17 and he who is boasting—in the Lord let him boast;
content_old: 17 and he who is boasting—in the Lord let him boast;

content: 1 O that ye were bearing with me a little of the folly, but ye also do bear with me:
content_old: 1 O that ye were bearing with me a little of the folly, but ye also do bear with me:

content: 2 for I am zealous for you with zeal of God, for I did betroth you to one husband, a pure virgin, to present to Christ,
content_old: 2 for I am zealous for you with zeal of God, for I did betroth you to one husband, a pure virgin, to present to Christ,

content: 3 and I fear, lest, as the serpent did beguile Eve in his subtilty, so your minds may be corrupted from the simplicity that is in the Christ;
content_old: 3 and I fear, lest, as the serpent did beguile Eve in his subtilty, so your minds may be corrupted from the simplicity that is in the Christ;

content: 4 for if, indeed, he who is coming doth preach another Jesus whom we did not preach, or another Spirit ye receive which ye did not receive, or other good news which ye did not accept—well were ye bearing it.
content_old: 4 for if, indeed, he who is coming doth preach another Jesus whom we did not preach, or another Spirit ye receive which ye did not receive, or other good news which ye did not accept—well were ye bearing it.

content: 5 For I reckon that I have been nothing behind the very chiefest apostles,
content_old: 5 For I reckon that I have been nothing behind the very chiefest apostles,

content: 6 and even if unlearned in word—yet not in knowledge, but in every thing we were made manifest in all things to you.
content_old: 6 and even if unlearned in word—yet not in knowledge, but in every thing we were made manifest in all things to you.

content: 7 The sin did I do—myself humbling that ye might be exalted, because freely the good news of God I did proclaim to you?
content_old: 7 The sin did I do—myself humbling that ye might be exalted, because freely the good news of God I did proclaim to you?

content: 8 other assemblies I did rob, having taken wages, for your ministration;
content_old: 8 other assemblies I did rob, having taken wages, for your ministration;

content: 9 and being present with you, and having been in want, I was chargeable to no one, for my lack did the brethren supply—having come from Macedonia—and in everything burdenless to you I did keep myself, and will keep.
content_old: 9 and being present with you, and having been in want, I was chargeable to no one, for my lack did the brethren supply—having come from Macedonia—and in everything burdenless to you I did keep myself, and will keep.

content: 10 The truth of Christ is in me, because this boasting shall not be stopped in regard to me in the regions of Achaia;
content_old: 10 The truth of Christ is in me, because this boasting shall not be stopped in regard to me in the regions of Achaia;

content: 11 wherefore? because I do not love you? God hath known!
content_old: 11 wherefore? because I do not love you? God hath known!

content: 12 and what I do, I also will do, that I may cut off the occasion of those wishing an occasion, that in that which they boast they may be found according as we also;
content_old: 12 and what I do, I also will do, that I may cut off the occasion of those wishing an occasion, that in that which they boast they may be found according as we also;

content: 13 for those such are false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into apostles of Christ,
content_old: 13 for those such are false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into apostles of Christ,

content: 14 and no wonder—for even the Adversary doth transform himself into a messenger of light;
content_old: 14 and no wonder—for even the Adversary doth transform himself into a messenger of light;

content: 15 no great thing, then, if also his ministrants do transform themselves as ministrants of righteousness—whose end shall be according to their works.
content_old: 15 no great thing, then, if also his ministrants do transform themselves as ministrants of righteousness—whose end shall be according to their works.

content: 16 Again I say, may no one think me to be a fool; and if otherwise, even as a fool receive me, that I also a little may boast.
content_old: 16 Again I say, may no one think me to be a fool; and if otherwise, even as a fool receive me, that I also a little may boast.

content: 17 That which I speak, I speak not according to the Lord, but as in foolishness, in this the confidence of boasting;
content_old: 17 That which I speak, I speak not according to the Lord, but as in foolishness, in this the confidence of boasting;

content: 18 since many boast according to the flesh, I also will boast:
content_old: 18 since many boast according to the flesh, I also will boast:

content: 19 for gladly do ye bear with the fools—being wise,
content_old: 19 for gladly do ye bear with the fools—being wise,

content: 20 for ye bear, if any one is bringing you under bondage, if any one doth devour, if any one doth take away, if any one doth exalt himself, if any one on the face doth smite you;
content_old: 20 for ye bear, if any one is bringing you under bondage, if any one doth devour, if any one doth take away, if any one doth exalt himself, if any one on the face doth smite you;

content: 21 in reference to dishonour I speak, how that we were weak, and in whatever any one is bold—in foolishness I say it—I also am bold.
content_old: 21 in reference to dishonour I speak, how that we were weak, and in whatever any one is bold—in foolishness I say it—I also am bold.

content: 22 Hebrews are they? I also! Israelites are they? I also! seed of Abraham are they? I also!
content_old: 22 Hebrews are they? I also! Israelites are they? I also! seed of Abraham are they? I also!

content: 23 ministrants of Christ are they?—as beside myself I speak—I more; in labours more abundantly, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequently, in deaths many times;
content_old: 23 ministrants of Christ are they?—as beside myself I speak—I more; in labours more abundantly, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequently, in deaths many times;

content: 24 from Jews five times forty stripes save one I did receive;
content_old: 24 from Jews five times forty stripes save one I did receive;

content: 25 thrice was I beaten with rods, once was I stoned, thrice was I shipwrecked, a night and a day in the deep I have passed;
content_old: 25 thrice was I beaten with rods, once was I stoned, thrice was I shipwrecked, a night and a day in the deep I have passed;

content: 26 journeyings many times, perils of rivers, perils of robbers, perils from kindred, perils from nations, perils in city, perils in wilderness, perils in sea, perils among false brethren;
content_old: 26 journeyings many times, perils of rivers, perils of robbers, perils from kindred, perils from nations, perils in city, perils in wilderness, perils in sea, perils among false brethren;

content: 27 in labouriousness and painfulness, in watchings many times, in hunger and thirst, in fastings many times, in cold and nakedness;
content_old: 27 in labouriousness and painfulness, in watchings many times, in hunger and thirst, in fastings many times, in cold and nakedness;

content: 28 apart from the things without—the crowding upon me that is daily—the care of all the assemblies.
content_old: 28 apart from the things without—the crowding upon me that is daily—the care of all the assemblies.

content: 29 Who is infirm, and I am not infirm? who is stumbled, and I am not fired;
content_old: 29 Who is infirm, and I am not infirm? who is stumbled, and I am not fired;

content: 30 if to boast it behoveth me, of the things of my infirmity I will boast;
content_old: 30 if to boast it behoveth me, of the things of my infirmity I will boast;

content: 31 the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ—who is blessed to the ages—hath known that I do not lie!—
content_old: 31 the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ—who is blessed to the ages—hath known that I do not lie!—

content: 32 In Damascus the ethnarch of Aretas the king was watching the city of the Damascenes, wishing to seize me,
content_old: 32 In Damascus the ethnarch of Aretas the king was watching the city of the Damascenes, wishing to seize me,

content: 1 To boast, really, is not profitable for me, for I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.
content_old: 1 To boast, really, is not profitable for me, for I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.

content: 2 I have known a man in Christ, fourteen years ago—whether in the body I have not known, whether out of the body I have not known, God hath known—such an one being caught away unto the third heaven;
content_old: 2 I have known a man in Christ, fourteen years ago—whether in the body I have not known, whether out of the body I have not known, God hath known—such an one being caught away unto the third heaven;

content: 3 and I have known such a man—whether in the body, whether out of the body, I have not known, God hath known,—
content_old: 3 and I have known such a man—whether in the body, whether out of the body, I have not known, God hath known,—

content: 4 that he was caught away to the paradise, and heard unutterable sayings, that it is not possible for man to speak.
content_old: 4 that he was caught away to the paradise, and heard unutterable sayings, that it is not possible for man to speak.

content: 5 Of such an one I will boast, and of myself I will not boast, except in my infirmities,
content_old: 5 Of such an one I will boast, and of myself I will not boast, except in my infirmities,

content: 6 for if I may wish to boast, I shall not be a fool, for truth I will say; but I forebear, lest any one in regard to me may think anything above what he doth see me, or doth hear anything of me;
content_old: 6 for if I may wish to boast, I shall not be a fool, for truth I will say; but I forebear, lest any one in regard to me may think anything above what he doth see me, or doth hear anything of me;

content: 7 and that by the exceeding greatness of the revelations I might not be exalted overmuch, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, a messenger of the Adversary, that he might buffet me, that I might not be exalted overmuch.
content_old: 7 and that by the exceeding greatness of the revelations I might not be exalted overmuch, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, a messenger of the Adversary, that he might buffet me, that I might not be exalted overmuch.

content: 8 Concerning this thing thrice the Lord did I call upon, that it might depart from me,
content_old: 8 Concerning this thing thrice the Lord did I call upon, that it might depart from me,

content: 9 and He said to me, ‘Sufficient for thee is My grace, for My power in infirmity is perfected;’ most gladly, therefore, will I rather boast in my infirmities, that the power of the Christ may rest on me:
content_old: 9 and He said to me, ‘Sufficient for thee is My grace, for My power in infirmity is perfected;’ most gladly, therefore, will I rather boast in my infirmities, that the power of the Christ may rest on me:

content: 10 wherefore I am well pleased in infirmities, in damages, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses—for Christ; for whenever I am infirm, then I am powerful;
content_old: 10 wherefore I am well pleased in infirmities, in damages, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses—for Christ; for whenever I am infirm, then I am powerful;

content: 11 I have become a fool—boasting; ye—ye did compel me; for I ought by you to have been commended, for in nothing was I behind the very chiefest apostles—even if I am nothing.
content_old: 11 I have become a fool—boasting; ye—ye did compel me; for I ought by you to have been commended, for in nothing was I behind the very chiefest apostles—even if I am nothing.

content: 12 The signs, indeed, of the apostle were wrought among you in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighty deeds,
content_old: 12 The signs, indeed, of the apostle were wrought among you in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighty deeds,

content: 13 for what is there in which ye were inferior to the rest of the assemblies, except that I myself was not a burden to you? forgive me this injustice!
content_old: 13 for what is there in which ye were inferior to the rest of the assemblies, except that I myself was not a burden to you? forgive me this injustice!

content: 14 Lo, a third time I am ready to come unto you, and I will not be a burden to you, for I seek not yours, but you, for the children ought not for the parents to lay up, but the parents for the children,
content_old: 14 Lo, a third time I am ready to come unto you, and I will not be a burden to you, for I seek not yours, but you, for the children ought not for the parents to lay up, but the parents for the children,

content: 15 and I most gladly will spend and be entirely spent for your souls, even if, more abundantly loving you, less I am loved.
content_old: 15 and I most gladly will spend and be entirely spent for your souls, even if, more abundantly loving you, less I am loved.

content: 16 And be it so, I—I did not burden you, but being crafty, with guile I did take you;
content_old: 16 And be it so, I—I did not burden you, but being crafty, with guile I did take you;

content: 17 any one of those whom I have sent unto you—by him did I take advantage of you?
content_old: 17 any one of those whom I have sent unto you—by him did I take advantage of you?

content: 18 I entreated Titus, and did send with him the brother; did Titus take advantage of you? in the same spirit did we not walk?—did we not in the same steps?
content_old: 18 I entreated Titus, and did send with him the brother; did Titus take advantage of you? in the same spirit did we not walk?—did we not in the same steps?

content: 19 Again, think ye that to you we are making defence? before God in Christ do we speak; and the all things, beloved, are for your up-building,
content_old: 19 Again, think ye that to you we are making defence? before God in Christ do we speak; and the all things, beloved, are for your up-building,

content: 20 for I fear lest, having come, not such as I wish I may find you, and I—I may be found by you such as ye do not wish, lest there be strifes, envyings, wraths, revelries, evil-speakings, whisperings, puffings up, insurrections,
content_old: 20 for I fear lest, having come, not such as I wish I may find you, and I—I may be found by you such as ye do not wish, lest there be strifes, envyings, wraths, revelries, evil-speakings, whisperings, puffings up, insurrections,

content: 1 This third time do I come unto you; on the mouth of two witnesses or three shall every saying be established;
content_old: 1 This third time do I come unto you; on the mouth of two witnesses or three shall every saying be established;

content: 2 I have said before, and I say it before, as being present, the second time, and being absent, now, do I write to those having sinned before, and to all the rest, that if I come again, I will not spare,
content_old: 2 I have said before, and I say it before, as being present, the second time, and being absent, now, do I write to those having sinned before, and to all the rest, that if I come again, I will not spare,

content: 3 since a proof ye seek of the Christ speaking in me, who to you is not infirm, but is powerful in you,
content_old: 3 since a proof ye seek of the Christ speaking in me, who to you is not infirm, but is powerful in you,

content: 4 for even if he was crucified from infirmity, yet he doth live from the power of God; for we also are weak in him, but we shall live with him from the power of God toward you.
content_old: 4 for even if he was crucified from infirmity, yet he doth live from the power of God; for we also are weak in him, but we shall live with him from the power of God toward you.

content: 5 Your own selves try ye, if ye are in the faith; your own selves prove ye; do ye not know your own selves, that Jesus Christ is in you, if ye be not in some respect disapproved of?
content_old: 5 Your own selves try ye, if ye are in the faith; your own selves prove ye; do ye not know your own selves, that Jesus Christ is in you, if ye be not in some respect disapproved of?

content: 6 and I hope that ye shall know that we—we are not disapproved of.
content_old: 6 and I hope that ye shall know that we—we are not disapproved of.

content: 7 And I pray before God that ye do no evil, not that we may appear approved, but that ye may do that which is right, and we may be as disapproved;
content_old: 7 And I pray before God that ye do no evil, not that we may appear approved, but that ye may do that which is right, and we may be as disapproved;

content: 8 for we are not able to do anything against the truth, but for the truth;
content_old: 8 for we are not able to do anything against the truth, but for the truth;

content: 9 for we rejoice when we may be infirm, and ye may be powerful; and this also we pray for—your perfection!
content_old: 9 for we rejoice when we may be infirm, and ye may be powerful; and this also we pray for—your perfection!

content: 10 because of this, these things—being absent—I write, that being present, I may not treat any sharply, according to the authority that the Lord did give me for building up, and not for casting down.
content_old: 10 because of this, these things—being absent—I write, that being present, I may not treat any sharply, according to the authority that the Lord did give me for building up, and not for casting down.

content: 11 Henceforth, brethren, rejoice; be made perfect, be comforted, be of the same mind, be at peace, and the God of the love and peace shall be with you;
content_old: 11 Henceforth, brethren, rejoice; be made perfect, be comforted, be of the same mind, be at peace, and the God of the love and peace shall be with you;

content: 12 salute one another in an holy kiss;
content_old: 12 salute one another in an holy kiss;

content: 13 salute you do all the saints;
content_old: 13 salute you do all the saints;
